discussion_comments.comment_body: For now I just copied the casing of `DAG` from the English locale file, but shouldn't this be `Dag`?

We agreed in the community (if you want to know the proof I'd need to search in devlist... but it is there) that from Airflow 3 onwards the term "Dag" is always with an upper case "D" and lower case "ag". (In the past=DAG==the acrony for Directed Acyclic Graph".

So: "Dag" is the corect one.
```suggestion
    "deleteDagWarning": "Dit zal alle metadata gerelateerd aan de Dag verwijderen, inclusief Dag Runs en Tasks.",
```
We want to keep the "heartbeat" in english?
[Heartbeat](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heartbeat_(Linux-HA_Daemon)) is accepted in technical writing in spanish. Other examples: token, backend or ping, etc

discussion_comments.comment_body: I think [this article from RAE](https://www.rae.es/ortograf%C3%ADa-b%C3%A1sica/uso-de-las-may%C3%BAsculas/la-may%C3%BAscula-en-siglas-y-acr%C3%B3nimos) answers correctly why I am using DAG instead of Dag. Technically speaking is more correct to use mayus

"연결"이라는 단어 보다는 "커넥션"이 개발자들에게 더 친숙한 표현인 것 같습니다.
따라서:
- 연결 -> 커넥션

@0ne-stone 오호 좋습니다 :)

"연결"이라고 표기된 번역들이 많은데 일관성을 위해서 "연결" --> "커넥션"으로 수정해서 따로 PR을 해주실 수 있으실까요?
